meanings.definition: To eat something quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: The hungry child will devour his favorite snack in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The wolves will devour their prey after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent3: Watching the movie, he seemed to devour the popcorn as if it was disappearing magically.
meanings.sent4: The flames seemed to devour everything in their path, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The book was so captivating that she felt like she could devour its pages in one sitting.

meanings.sent1: The termites slowly devour the wooden structure of the old house.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire can quickly devour acres of forest in a matter of hours.
meanings.sent3: The toddler seemed to devour his toys, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake.
meanings.sent4: The gossip seemed to devour the reputation of the unsuspecting celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The addiction can devour a person's life, leaving them with nothing but regret.
